xs:annotation.xs:documentation: All Schema files in the OTA specification are made available according to the terms defined by the OTA License Agreement at http://www.opentravel.org/ota_downloads_form.cfm
The OTA_PingRQ message may be used for testing application connectivity, sending some specific text and determining if the receiving application is able to echo back that same text.
The free-text data that is expected to be echoed back in the response message.
All Schema files in the OTA specification are made available according to the terms defined by the OTA License Agreement at http://www.opentravel.org/ota_downloads_form.cfm
The OTA_PingRS message is a response to a client message used for testing application connectivity. Specific text sent by the client is to be echoed back in this response.
The free-text data that is to be echoed back.
All Schema files in the OTA specification are made available according to the terms defined by the OTA License Agreement at http://www.opentravel.org/ota_downloads_form.cfm

The Availability Request message requests Flight Availability for a city pair on a specific date for a specific number and type of passengers. Optional request information can include: - Time / Time Window - Connecting cities. - Client Preferences (airlines, cabin, flight types etc.) The request can be narrowed to request availability for a specific airline, specific flight, or specific booking class on a specific flight. The availability request message contains similar information to a standard Airline CRS or GDS availability request message.
Point of sale object.
A collection of information that specifies how the message processing should occur or how the data should be returned.
Information on the locations between which availability is to be checked.
To specify a flight for this origin and destination for which availability is to be checked.
Traveler preference information for this particular origin and destination.
If true, the return departure must be from the same airport as the outbound arrival.
Uniquely identifies this origin destination information.
Information used to specify a flight for which availablity is to be checked.
Air Availability Request preference information.
Used to specify passenger and fare information for which availablity is to be checked.
Contains the reservation segment details to be modified.
A boolean flag to indicate whether to quote the flexi-charges with the availability search.
Maximum number of responses desired in the response message.
All Schema files in the OTA specification are made available according to the terms defined by the OTA License Agreement at http://www.opentravel.org/ota_downloads_form.cfm

The Availability Response message contains Flight Availability for a city pair on a specific date. A set of OriginDestinationOptions is returned, each of which contains one or more (connecting) flights that serve the city pair. For each flight the following information is returned: - Origin and destination airports - Departure and arrival date/times - Booking Class availability - Equipment - Meal Information - Codeshare information. This message contains similar information to a standard airline CRS or GDS availability response message.
Standard way to indicate successful processing of an OTA message. Returning an empty element of this type indicates success.
Standard way to indicate successful processing of an OTA message, but one in which warnings are generated.

xs:documentation.DeprecationWarning: Candidate for potential removal, usage is not recommended. Deprecation Warning added in 2006A

xs:annotation.xs:documentation: Container for OriginDestinationOption.
Defines Origin and Destination information.
Holds the collection of flight options for this origin-destination pair. There maybe limits imposed by individual supplier that are below the maximum occurrences for this element.
Details of the flight option for an origin destination pair.
Flight segment information returned for an availability request including ancillary information.
Traffic restriction information for a specific flight.
Any special comments on the leg. eg. operated by XX.
The airline specific branding for cabins.
Booking codes available to be sold for a particular flight segment.
RPH refers back to Marketing Cabin Type."
The duration of the flight from departure location to destination location.
Specifies if the flight is smoking or not.
Specifies the Dept. of Transport on time rate of the flight.
Specifies if the flight is e-ticketable or not.
To specify the level of participation by a vendor in another system. Refer to OTA Code List 'Participation Level Code' (PLC).
The duration of a ground stop.
The total duration time of the flight. This is the combination of both JourneyDuration and GroundDuration.
Miles acquired per flight segment, usually used for earning of frequent flyer miles.
Information on the locations between which availability was requested.
A container for origin destination option information.
Holds the collection of flight options for this origin-destination pair. There maybe limits imposed by individual supplier that are below the maximum occurrences for this element.
Details of the flight option for an origin destination pair.
Flight segment information returned for an availability request including ancillary information.
Traffic restriction information for a specific flight.
Any special comments on the leg. eg. operated by XX.
The airline specific branding for cabins.
Booking codes available to be sold for a particular flight segment.
RPH refers back to Marketing Cabin Type."
The duration of the flight from departure location to destination location.
Specifies if the flight is smoking or not.
Specifies the Dept. of Transport on time rate of the flight.
Specifies if the flight is e-ticketable or not.
To specify the level of participation by a vendor in another system. Refer to OTA Code List 'Participation Level Code' (PLC).
The duration of a ground stop.
The total duration time of the flight. This is the combination of both JourneyDuration and GroundDuration.
Miles acquired per flight segment, usually used for earning of frequent flyer miles.
If true, the return departure must be from the same airport as the outbound arrival.
Uniquely identifies this origin destination information.
Information that may apply to the entire response, such as marketing or header information.
AccelAero Extensions for OTA_AirAvailRS, which is included as TPA_Extension
Provides priced itinerary information.
A collection of errors that occurred during the processing of a message.
All Schema files in the OTA specification are made available according to the terms defined by the OTA License Agreement at http://www.opentravel.org/ota_downloads_form.cfm

The Availability Request message requests pricing information for specific flights on specific dates for a specific number and type of passengers. Optional information in the message allows fare restriction preferences and negotiated fare contract codes to be included in the message. The pricing request contains the information necessary to perform an availability / sell from availability / price series of entries on an airline CRS or GDS.
Point of sale object.
The Air Itineraries to be priced
Specify passenger numbers and types
Contains the reservation segment details to be modified.
The flexibility selection options.
Indicates whether to select out-bound flexi fares.
Indicates whether to select in-bound flexi fares.
All Schema files in the OTA specification are made available according to the terms defined by the OTA License Agreement at http://www.opentravel.org/ota_downloads_form.cfm

The Pricing Response message contains a 'Priced Itinerary'. This includes: - The set of flights sent in the Pricing request message - Pricing information including taxes and full fare breakdown for each passenger type - Ticketing information - Fare Basis Codes and the information necessary to make a Fare Rules entry. This message contains similar information to a standard airline CRS or GDS itinerary pricing response message.
Standard way to indicate successful processing of an OTA message. Returning an empty element of this type indicates success.
Standard way to indicate successful processing of an OTA message, but one in which warnings are generated.
Provides priced itinerary information.
A collection of errors that occurred during the processing of a message.
The OTA_PayloadStdAttributes defines the standard attributes that appear on the root element for all OTA payloads.
All Schema files in the OTA specification are made available according to the terms defined by the OTA License Agreement at http://www.opentravel.org/ota_downloads_form.cfm

The Book Request message requests the system to book a specific itinerary for one or more identified passengers. The message contains optional pricing information, allowing the booking class availability and pricing to be rechecked as part of the booking process. Optional request information can include:- Seat and Meal Requests- SSR, OSI, and Remarks.
This identifes the party making the booking request. Trading partners are open to define their own UniqueID.
A collection of all flight segments requested for booking.
Pricing information for the air itinerary to be booked e.g. this data could come from the OTA_AirPriceRS data.
All traveler information relevant to a booking request.
All payment information relevant to a booking request.
Container for Payment Detail.
Form of payment details for the requested booking. It is possible to use multiple forms of payment for one transaction, therefore this element may be used more than once.
Ticket delivery information for the booking request.
Purchaser name details
Specifies the requested distribution method for the ticket receipt.
Refer to OTA Code List Distribution Type (DTB).
Information used to specify the ticketing arrangement.
Specifies information necessary to place this booking on a particular host system queue.
A 3 character ATA/IATA airport/city code of the system that delivers the message.
A number specifying the requested queue in which the PNR should be placed in the host system.
A subdivision of a particular queue used to provide additional functional granularity.
Date/time when the time initiated queuing should take place.
Text describing why the queuing takes place.
Identifies airline/system on which the reservation is being queued.
This is used for PNR record locator.
All Schema files in the OTA specification are made available according to the terms defined by the OTA License Agreement at http://www.opentravel.org/ota_downloads_form.cfm

The Book Response message contains the itinerary, passenger and pricing information sent in the request, along with a Booking reference number (PNR Locator) and ticketing information if the booking was successful. This message contains similar information to a standard airline CRS or GDS Display PNR message.
Standard way to indicate successful processing of an OTA message. Returning an empty element of this type indicates success.
Standard way to indicate successful processing of an OTA message, but one in which warnings are generated.
Contains all booking response information pertaining to a completed reservation.
A collection of errors that occurred during the processing of a message.
AWG to revisit.
The OTA_PayloadStdAttributes defines the standard attributes that appear on the root element for all OTA payloads.
All Schema files in the OTA specification are made available according to the terms defined by the OTA License Agreement at http://www.opentravel.org/ota_downloads_form.cfm

The AirBook Modify Request message requests the system to modify an existing booking for one or more identified passengers. The message may be used for any kind of modification to a booking file, i.e. a modification to existing flight segments and special service information the addition of new elements, a name change or a booking file split. Analogous to the TTY process, existing data is submitted as well as the modified data. Attribute 'Operation' indicates the way elements have to be changed. Flight segments as well as seats- and special service requests will indicate a modification using the appropriate Status attribute.
This identifes the party making the modification request. Trading partners are open to define their own UniqueID.
Contains the new value of data which is to be modified.
Specifies the type of booking modification being requested. Refer to OTA Code List Modification Type (MOD).
Contains all booking information of the current reservation, in this case of the reservation which is to be modified.
All Schema files in the OTA specification are made available according to the terms defined by the OTA License Agreement at http://www.opentravel.org/ota_downloads_form.cfm
A generic message, available as an action on several OTA services which requests a server to read and return the document type identified by the UniqueID element.
Identifies the party or connection channel making the request.
A reference to identify the booking.
A grouping of Read Requests
A request to read a reservation when the booking reference is known.
The booking reference for the reservation.

This is to be used for verification that the record being sent is the specific record requested. This is optional and is intended to provide a more secure mechanism to ensure the correct record is being sent.
An individual Read Request for a global reservation when the booking reference is not known
The name of the traveler for whom the reservation is requested.
The travel start date.
To retrieve an airline reservation when the booking reference is not known or to search for a list of passengers meeting certain criteria
To request a list of reservations made by specified travel agent, ERSP, booking channel, etc.
Specify airline on which the person is booked.
Specific flight number on which the passenger is booked.
Flight Origin - IATA 3 letter code.
Request a reservation with this departure date.
Request a reservation based on a passenger name.
Request a reservation based on a telephone number.
Request booking records based on frequent flyer information.
Request booking records by credit card information.
Request booking record by ticket number.
Requests items from a booking file queue.
Specifies queue information.
An ATA/IATA airport/city code, office code, pseudo city code, etc. of the queue to be returned. If this is omitted, the pseudo city code contained in the point of sale information should be used.
Identifies the airline and/or system where the queue resides. If this is omitted, the airline and/or system code (AirlineVendorID) contained in the point of sale information should be used.
An identifier specifying the requested queue on which the booking file resides in the system.
If true, only the first item on the queue is to be returned. If false, all items on the queue are to be returned.

If true, items are to be removed from the queue after display. If false, items are to remain on the queue after display. If this attribute is omitted, items on the queue are to be retained on the queue.
Option to define if the full booking file data need to be returned. If true, all booking file info is returned. If false, only the condensed info is returned.
Bookings modified after this start date or date time should be returned. If used in conjunction with an end date, only bookings modified within that date range should be returned.
Bookings modified before this end date or date time should be returned. If used in conjunction with a start date, only bookings modified within that date range should be returned.
To specify a seat number to be used as criteria for requesting a booking record.
When requesting booking records by frequent flyer level, this is used to indicate that booking records with the codeshare equivalent partner level should also be returned.
To specify that FF number should be returned for each booking record in the list. The default is do not return, set to true, the FF number should be returned.
To specify that downline segment info should be returned. The default is do not return, set to true, the information should be returned.
To specify what type of FF level information should be returned.
To specify criteria as to whether to return only the FF level specified or levels above and below.
To specify the type of reservation, Global, Air, Hotel, Car, Package, or Golf, that is being requested. Refer to OTA Code List Travel Sector (TVS).
To indicate if a list should always be returned even when only one reservation matches the input criteria. The default is to return the reservation record. If set to true, then always return a list.
Used to indicate a maximum number of items desired in the list response message or when used for subsequent retrievals of additional data the MoreDataEchoToken determines where to continue the list.
All Schema files in the OTA specification are made available according to the terms defined by the OTA License Agreement at http://www.opentravel.org/ota_downloads_form.cfm
This message returns a list of reservations when an exact match on a read request could not be made or the request was to return a list of reservations meeting specified criteria.
The presence of the empty Success element explicitly indicates that the OTA versioned message succeeded.
Used in conjunction with the Success element to define one or more business errors.

A container for multiple reservations. The list of reservations will be one of global reservations, air reservations, hotel reservations, package reservations, golf reservations, or vehicle reservations
One line in a list of airline reservations. It may contain the PNR locator, flight segment information, traveler name, and itinerary name.
The airline code, flight number, departure and arrival dates, and the origin and destination.
The names of travelers (up to five) in the reservation.
The reservation id number, PNR locator.
Date of the creation of this reservation.
A name given to this itinerary.
One line in a list of reservations from a global distribution system. It may contain the booking reference, the person name, start date, and an itinerary name.
The booking reference ID.
The name of the first traveler in the reservation.
A name given to this itinerary.
The first date of the reservation, i.e., check-in date, departure date, pickup date, etc.
Errors is returned if the request was unable to be processed.
Use the MoreDataEchoToken to indicate the last record in the list. Used in subsequent requests, to identify where the last response left off.
All Schema files in the OTA specification are made available according to the terms defined by the OTA License Agreement at http://www.opentravel.org/ota_downloads_form.cfm

The Schedule Request message requests Flight Schedules for a city pair. Optional request information can include: - Time / Time Window - Connecting cities. - Client Preferences (airlines, cabin, flight types etc.) The request can be narrowed to request schedules for a specific airline or specific flight.
Point of sale object.
Origin and Destination location, and time information for the Air Schedule request.
Specific airline and flight number for which a schedule is being requested.
Specify vendors to include and exclude from the response.
Flight Type Preferences to qualify Air Schedule request.
Equipment Preference to qualify Air Schedule request.
All Schema files in the OTA specification are made available according to the terms defined by the OTA License Agreement at http://www.opentravel.org/ota_downloads_form.cfm

The Schedule Response message contains Flight Schedules for a city pair. A set of OriginDestinationOptions is returned, each of which contains one or more (connecting) flights that serve the city pair. For each flight the following information is returned: - Origin and destination airports - Departure and arrival times - Days of Operation - Effective Date and End Date -Equipment - Meal Information - Codeshare information. This message contains similar information to the OTA_AirAvailabilityRS message except it does not contain inventory availability.
Standard way to indicate successful processing of an OTA message. Returning an empty element of this type indicates success.
Standard way to indicate successful processing of an OTA message, but one in which warnings are generated.
Origin and Destination location, and time information for the Air Schedule request.
Holds the collection of flight options for this origin-destination pair. There maybe limits imposed by individual supplier that are below the maximum occurrences for this element.
A collection of one or more legs that are defined as a single flight number.
Any special comments on the leg. eg. operated by XX.
Identifies the marketing name for the cabin. This is the supplier cabin identifier as opposed to the generic industry term for the cabin.
Identifies the days of week the flight operates.
The duration of the flight from departure location to destination location.
Specifies if the flight is smoking or not.
Specifies the Dept. of Transport on time rate of the flight.
Identifies the start date for the scheduled flight.
Identifies the end date for the scheduled flight.
A collection of errors that occurred during the processing of a message.
All Schema files in the OTA specification are made available according to the terms defined by the OTA License Agreement at http://www.opentravel.org/ota_downloads_form.cfm
Retrieve real-time flight departure, arrival and gate information for a particular flight, including actual as well as scheduled departure and arrival times.
Point of sale object.
Specify airline to request FLIFO details.
Specific flight number to request details for. Requires that Airline is also supplied.
Date of departure for flight information.
Specifies the departure location.
Specifies the arrival location.
All Schema files in the OTA specification are made available according to the terms defined by the OTA License Agreement at http://www.opentravel.org/ota_downloads_form.cfm
Details of flight departure, arrival and gate information for a particular flight, including actual as well as scheduled departure and arrival times.

Standard way to indicate successful processing of an OTA message.
Returning an empty element of this type indicates success.

Standard way to indicate successful processing of an OTA message, but
one in which warnings are generated.
Collection of flight information for a flight number.
Information regarding each leg of the flight. A flight leg is one departure and one arrival (non-stop sector).
Departure airport for flight leg.
Any special comments about the departure airport.
Arrival point of flight segment. Second occurrence indicates diversion airport.
Any special comments about the arrival airport.
Indicates the flight has diverted to this airport.
Specifies the location or carousel number for baggage from the arriving flight.
The marketing airline.
The operating airline of the flight if it is a codeshare flight.
The type of equipment used for the flight..
Any special comments on the leg such as travel advisory messages, passenger advisory messages, etc.
Specifies scheduled and other date time information.
Scheduled departure date/time for flight leg.
Estimated departure date/time for flight leg.
Actual operational departure date/time for flight leg.
The reason attributed to a delay or cancellation. Refers to OTA Code Table FDC.
Specifies the time when the next information will be published.
Specifies scheduled and other date time information.
Scheduled arrival date/time for flight leg.
Estimated arrival date/time for flight leg.
Actual operational arrival date/time for flight leg.
The reason attributed to a delay or cancellation. Refers to OTA Code Table FDC.
A collection of OperationTimes.
Provides information on operational events for this flight leg e.g. off-ground.
Time or date/time an operational event happened.
Type of operational event (e.g., off-ground). References the OTA Code Table OTT.
Describes whether the operational event time is scheduled, estimated or actual.
The actual operation time.
The scheduled time.
The estimated time.
The reason attributed to a delay or cancellation. Refers to OTA Code Table FDC.
Status of the current flight operation.
Any special comments on the flight.
Indicates various status information about the flight such as real-time, scheduled or flight cancelled.
A collection of errors that occurred during the processing of a message.

The OTA_PayloadStdAttributes defines the standard attributes that
appear on the root element for all OTA payloads.
All Schema files in the OTA specification are made available according to the terms defined by the OTA License Agreement at http://www.opentravel.org/ota_downloads_form.cfm

The Seat map Request message requests seat map details for one or more flight segments for specific dates. The request can include the PNR number , frequent flier numbers etc. The seat map response contains the actual seat map based on the input conditions in the request message. Every flight segment wil have a separate seat map detail
Point of sale object.
The seat map request element containing hte details of the request.

The number of flight segments for which the Seat Map is requested for. If an itinerary consists of multiple flight segments then corresponding number of SeatMapRequest elements will be sent in the request. If there is a gauge change (equipment change) within a flight segment an error response is expected. In such a case two different Seat MapRequest elements need to be sent requesting seatmap for two flight segments for different gauges.
Flight segment information of the flight segment for which seat map information is requested.
Object to hold the seat details that is to be requested.
if the seat map display is to be requested for a specific cabin class , the cabin class can be specified in this element.
cabin type for which the seat map is requested, which could be either First, Business or Economy
A collection of ResBookDesignations.
If the seat map display is requested for the cabin class in which a particular booking designator code (booking class) lies then that booking class can be specified in this element.

If the booking class is know for which the seat map is to be requested then the specific Booking class code can be entered here. The response will have the seat map for the cabin class in which the said booking classcode belongs.
SeatUpgrade will be set to true if the passenger is looking for an upgrade and the seat map response expected is after the upgrade, if applicable
Reference to one or more travelers for whom seat map is requested for this flight segment. RPH Value from TravelerRefNumber of AirTravelerType element will be mapped here.
Collection of AirTravelers.
This specifies the quantity and types of passengers.
Individuals complete name information
Frequent Flier information of the passenger
Direct reference of traveler assigned by requesting system. Used as a cross reference between data segments.This value will be mapped to the RPH value in TravelRefNumber of the SeatMapRequest element
Indicates if an infant accompanying a traveler is with or without a seat.
This is used for PNR record locator. If there are more than one PNR numbers because of muliple airlines in the itinerary then this element could be repeated.
All Schema files in the OTA specification are made available according to the terms defined by the OTA License Agreement at http://www.opentravel.org/ota_downloads_form.cfm

The SeatMap Response message contains the seat map details for the request options given for the requested flight segments. This may include multiple seatmaps in case of different seat maps returned for different passengers in the same flight segment.
Seat map response element containing the results of the request
One SeatMapResponse element is returned for each of the flight segment requested in the input request.
The flight segment for which the seat map is sent.

This identifies the seat map details for the flight segment in the corresponding 'FlightSegmentInfo' element. If the responding system has different seat maps for different passengers for the same flight segment then this element will reccur accordingly. The availability of seats can differ based upon various conditions, such as a passenger's status within a loyalty program or by the amount paid or class of service booked for the ticket. For example, if one passenger has a certain status in the Frequent Flyer program of the airline, certain desirable seats may be available for selection. A passenger without such status may not be able to select those seats. Thus the availability of seats can differ by passenger.
This is used for PNR record locator. If there are more than one PNR numbers because of muliple airlines in the itinerary then this element could be repeated.
This indicates if the respone has the Seat Map upgrade applied
Collection of AirTravelers.
This specifies the quantity and types of passengers.
Individuals complete name information
Frequent Flier information of the passenger
Direct reference of traveler assigned by requesting system. Used as a cross reference between data segments.This value will be mapped to the RPH value in TravelRefNumber of the SeatMapRequest element
Indicates if an infant accompanying a traveler is with or without a seat.
All Schema files in the OTA specification are made available according to the terms defined by the OTA License Agreement at http://www.opentravel.org/ota_downloads_form.cfm
Container for insurance quote requests
Container for any Point-of-sale information.
Requests a quote for a single insurance plan

Container for insurance plan quote results
Indicator for successful request processing
Contains a quote response for a single insurance plan.
Contains the information about the plan, such as the name of the insurance company and restrictions, specific to the quote.
Identifies the company providing the insurance product quoted in this response message.
Specifies the location of a file containing specific details regarding this quote.
Container for any restrictions to coverage of the quoted plan.
Specifies the location of a file containing booking details
Allows vendor to echo back information about the traveler(s)' requirements for insurance coverage.
Contains information about the total price of the insurance plan.
Defines contact information for an individual or company (for example, the provider's callcenter number or claims hotline).

Balance amounts when performing reservation modifications. Used in cancel segment, cancel reservation, add segment, modify segment, add infant and remove pax processes to show balance amounts. New balances (except OND balances) are formed with respect to the overall reservation.
Balances for OND being modified.
Pricing info summary on ONDs for modification process(charges and refundable/non-refundable amounts).

abcd

Itinerary Response

The meal details Request message requests meal details for one or more flight segments for specific dates. The request can include the PNR number , frequent flier numbers etc. The meal details response contains the actual meal details based on the input conditions in the request message. Every flight segment will have a separate meal detail
Point of sale object.
The meal details request element containing the details of the request.

The number of flight segments for which the meal details are requested for. If an itinerary consists of multiple flight segments then corresponding number of MealDetailsRequest elements will be sent in the request. If there is a gauge change (equipment change) within a flight segment an error response is expected. In such a case two different mealDetailsRequest elements need to be sent requesting meal details for two flight segments for different gauges.
Flight segment information of the flight segment for which meal information is requested.
Object to hold the meal details that is to be requested.
if the meal display is to be requested for a specific cabin class , the cabin class can be specified in this element.
cabin type for which the meal details are requested, which could be either First, Business or Economy
A collection of ResBookDesignations.
If the meal details display is requested for the cabin class in which a particular booking designator code (booking class) lies then that booking class can be specified in this element.

If the booking class is know for which the meal details are to be requested then the specific Booking class code can be entered here. The response will have the meal details for the cabin class in which the said booking classcode belongs.
Reference to one or more travelers for whom meal details requested for this flight segment. RPH Value from TravelerRefNumber of AirTravelerType element will be mapped here.
Collection of AirTravelers.
This specifies the quantity and types of passengers.
Individuals complete name information
Frequent Flier information of the passenger

Direct reference of traveler assigned by requesting system. Used as a cross reference between data segments.This value will be mapped to the RPH value in TravelRefNumber of the MealDetailsRequest element
This is used for PNR record locator. If there are more than one PNR numbers because of muliple airlines in the itinerary then this element could be repeated.
The Meal Details Response message contains the meal details for the request options given for the requested flight segments.
Meal details response element containing the results of the request
One MealDetailsResponse element is returned for each of the flight segment requested in the input request.
The flight segment for which the meal details are sent.
This identifies the meal details for the flight segment in the corresponding 'FlightSegmentInfo' element.
This is used for PNR record locator. If there are more than one PNR numbers because of muliple airlines in the itinerary then this element could be repeated.
Collection of AirTravelers.
This specifies the quantity and types of passengers.
Individuals complete name information
Frequent Flier information of the passenger

Direct reference of traveler assigned by requesting system. Used as a cross reference between data segments.This value will be mapped to the RPH value in TravelRefNumber of the MealDetailsRequest element

The ssr details Request message requests ssr details for one or more flight segments for specific dates. The request can include the PNR number , frequent flier numbers etc. The ssr details response contains the actual ssr details based on the input conditions in the request message. Every flight segment will have a separate ssr detail
Point of sale object.
The ssr details request element containing the details of the request.

The number of flight segments for which the ssr details are requested for. If an itinerary consists of multiple flight segments then corresponding number of ssrDetailsRequest elements will be sent in the request. If there is a gauge change (equipment change) within a flight segment an error response is expected. In such a case two different ssrDetailsRequest elements need to be sent requesting ssr details for two flight segments for different gauges.
Flight segment information of the flight segment for which ssr information is requested.
Object to hold the ssr details that is to be requested.
if the ssr display is to be requested for a specific cabin class , the cabin class can be specified in this element.
cabin type for which the ssr details are requested, which could be either First, Business or Economy
A collection of ResBookDesignations.
If the ssr details display is requested for the cabin class in which a particular booking designator code (booking class) lies then that booking class can be specified in this element.

If the booking class is know for which the ssr details are to be requested then the specific Booking class code can be entered here. The response will have the ssr details for the cabin class in which the said booking classcode belongs.

Holds SSR type to differentiate In-flight services and airport services. Insert 'INFLIGHT' for in-flight services and 'AIRPORT' for airport services. If no value is provided system will consider it as an In-flight service.
Reference to one or more travelers for whom ssr details requested for this flight segment. RPH Value from TravelerRefNumber of AirTravelerType element will be mapped here.
Collection of AirTravelers.
This specifies the quantity and types of passengers.
Individuals complete name information
Frequent Flier information of the passenger

Direct reference of traveler assigned by requesting system. Used as a cross reference between data segments.This value will be mapped to the RPH value in TravelRefNumber of the ssrDetailsRequest element
This is used for PNR record locator. If there are more than one PNR numbers because of muliple airlines in the itinerary then this element could be repeated.
The ssr Details Response message contains the ssr details for the request options given for the requested flight segments.
ssr details response element containing the results of the request
One ssrDetailsResponse element is returned for each of the flight segment requested in the input request.
The flight segment for which the ssr details are sent.
This identifies the Airport Service details for the flight segment in the corresponding 'FlightSegmentInfo' element.
This identifies the In-flight Service details for the flight segment in the corresponding 'FlightSegmentInfo' element.
This is used for PNR record locator. If there are more than one PNR numbers because of muliple airlines in the itinerary then this element could be repeated.
Collection of AirTravelers.
This specifies the quantity and types of passengers.
Individuals complete name information
Frequent Flier information of the passenger

Direct reference of traveler assigned by requesting system. Used as a cross reference between data segments.This value will be mapped to the RPH value in TravelRefNumber of the ssrDetailsRequest element

The baggage details Request message requests baggage details for one or more flight segments for specific dates. The request can include the PNR number , frequent flier numbers etc. The baggage details response contains the actual baggage details based on the input conditions in the request message. Every flight segment will have a separate baggage detail
Point of sale object.
The baggage details request element containing the details of the request.

The number of flight segments for which the baggage details are requested for. If an itinerary consists of multiple flight segments then corresponding number of BaggageDetailsRequest elements will be sent in the request. If there is a gauge change (equipment change) within a flight segment an error response is expected. In such a case two different baggageDetailsRequest elements need to be sent requesting baggage details for two flight segments for different gauges.
Flight segment information of the flight segment for which baggage information is requested.
Object to hold the baggage details that is to be requested.
if the baggage display is to be requested for a specific cabin class , the cabin class can be specified in this element.
cabin type for which the baggage details are requested, which could be either First, Business or Economy
A collection of ResBookDesignations.
If the baggage details display is requested for the cabin class in which a particular booking designator code (booking class) lies then that booking class can be specified in this element.

If the booking class is know for which the baggage details are to be requested then the specific Booking class code can be entered here. The response will have the baggage details for the cabin class in which the said booking classcode belongs.
Reference to one or more travelers for whom baggage details requested for this flight segment. RPH Value from TravelerRefNumber of AirTravelerType element will be mapped here.
Specifies the preferred currency code for the baggage charge amounts
Collection of AirTravelers.
This specifies the quantity and types of passengers.
Individuals complete name information
Frequent Flier information of the passenger

Direct reference of traveler assigned by requesting system. Used as a cross reference between data segments.This value will be mapped to the RPH value in TravelRefNumber of the BaggageDetailsRequest element
This is used for PNR record locator. If there are more than one PNR numbers because of muliple airlines in the itinerary then this element could be repeated.
The Baggage Details Response message contains the baggage details for the request options given for the requested flight segments.
Baggage details response element containing the results of the request
One BaggageDetailsResponse element is returned for each of the flight segment requested in the input request.
The flight segment for which the baggage details are sent.
This identifies the baggage details for the flight segment in the corresponding 'FlightSegmentInfo' element.
This is used for PNR record locator. If there are more than one PNR numbers because of muliple airlines in the itinerary then this element could be repeated.
One BaggageDetailsResponse element is returned for combine flight segments requested in the input request.
The flight segment for which the baggage details are sent.
This identifies the baggage details for the flight segment in the corresponding 'FlightSegmentInfo' element.
This is used for PNR record locator. If there are more than one PNR numbers because of muliple airlines in the itinerary then this element could be repeated.
Collection of AirTravelers.
This specifies the quantity and types of passengers.
Individuals complete name information
Frequent Flier information of the passenger

Direct reference of traveler assigned by requesting system. Used as a cross reference between data segments.This value will be mapped to the RPH value in TravelRefNumber of the BaggageDetailsRequest element
